TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
One word:WOW!

I can't wait to test these baby's!

Thanks!

A wild link has appeared! http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81756-Eyes-Turned-Skywards

Very interesting! Thank you everyone for these links.

So these concept crafts are already being made by others? Bummer

I am absolutely loving the Chinese One.

I also think its funny how even in this "Optimistic" alternate history humanity is just returning to the Moon (unless there's more).

I have added DR configs. I think they work correctly, but maybe others with more experience with this mod will help me.

Edited June 22, 2014 by Beale

Following the success of the KTTP, and with the Vega and the Super 25 released the same day, there was only one thing i could do:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Far from "being made by others" I am actively *trying* to get people to make them

Plus, the hirez source files are available for use as guides, or for baking textures. However, the style is...quite different from this pack's style. :]

The TKS poses a real problem with its scale.

You see if I make the VA 2.5m it looks far too big.

If 1.25m, then the end of the return engine will end in something smaller than 0.625 (not a big problem if docking port is on the back?) and the craft will look to small overall.

Thoughts?

Edited June 22, 2014 by Beale

Thoughts?

Well, the real spacecraft's VA had 2.8 m diameter, and reentry capsule of real Soyuz is at 2.2 m, which is certainly not as big of a difference as between ingame 1.25 m and 2.5 m capsules (~1.27 proportion for real world, 2 for game). So I'd say go for 1.25 capsule diameter to keep current scale and make bigger radial fuel tanks for it.

Thoughts?

Actually 2.5m (at least for the FGB) is alright. Here's drawing of Cosmos-1686 (unmanned TKS prototype) and Salyut-7:

TKS cutaway:

My thoughts is: 2.5m FGB, non-standard (1.8m or 2.0m) VA and 0.625m LES.
Polaris and SXT based TKS in polar orbit
Maybe the solution are 1,875 parts. IMHO

Well, the real spacecraft's VA had 2.8 m diameter, and reentry capsule of real Soyuz is at 2.2 m, which is certainly not as big of a difference as between ingame 1.25 m and 2.5 m capsules (~1.27 proportion for real world, 2 for game). So I'd say go for 1.25 capsule diameter to keep current scale and make bigger radial fuel tanks for it.

This is my current thinking. With 1.25m crew and engine block stretching 1.875m.

See MIR-like setup.

Awesome to see the Polaris still in use! (new one is coming soon, don't worry ) And thankyou this is a good see of TKS size, I think maybe Salyut should have been bigger (3m maybe?)

Maybe the solution are 1,875 parts. IMHO

Hi!

Though 1.875m parts would give perfect scale for TKS, I am not sure if I would like to embark on this road. The 1.875m parts work in the HGR pack because the creator has put in work and made a whole new subsytem of 1.875m parts (engines, structure, tanks).

To make the TKS VA 1.875 in diameter is kind of a risk, as I would at minimum have to create some basic adapters to normal sizes.

More thoughts? I am a fan of teeny-tiny craft myself, but I am quite strange in this it seems.

Edited June 23, 2014 by Beale

could you compile all of the download links into one?

combining it on my computer gives me... issues...

This is my current thinking. With 1.25m crew and engine block stretching 1.875m.

I'd use your stockalike soyuz for reference, but I think that would work pretty well. You could always do a quick scaled drawing of them to see which looks best to you.

I think that a 1.875 m TKS would be perfect, you can add a couple of adapters to 1,25 and 2,5 meters (they shouldn't be too difficult to make) and say "if you want more 1.875 m parts you can also download HGR pack!

I have built a TKS, but I think that 2.5 m is too big:
